verse.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
verse.verse_3: And what did you know how is that inevitable?
verse.verse_4: Thamud and Aad belied that strong calamity.
verse.verse_5: Then as for Thamud, they were destroyed with an extreme uproar.
verse.verse_6: And as for Aad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring windstorm.
verse.verse_7: Which He subjected them forcefully for seven nights and eight days consecutively, then see those people in it lying down, as though they were trunks of palm-trees lying down.
verse.verse_8: Do you see any remnant of them?
verse.verse_9: And Firawn and those before him, and the overthrown towns committed error.
verse.verse_10: And they disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord, therefore He seized them with a strong seizing.
verse.verse_11: Undoubtedly, when the water rose high, We bore you in the boat.
verse.verse_12: That We might make it a reminder for you and it might be ratained by the ears that retain after hearing.
verse.verse_13: Then when the trumpet is blown instantly.
verse.verse_14: And the earth and the mountains are being crushed after lifting up all at once.
verse.verse_15: That is the day when will happen the inevitable event.
verse.verse_16: And the heaven will cleave asunder, then on the day it will be in a miserable condition.
verse.verse_17: And the angels will be standing on the sides thereof, and on that day the eight angles will bear over them the throne of your Lord.
verse.verse_18: On that day you all shall be presented and no hiding soul shall remain hidden.
verse.verse_19: Then as to him whose record shall be given in his right hand, he will say, 'take and read my record.'
verse.verse_20: I was convinced that I would reach to my accounting.
verse.verse_21: Therefore he is in his desired comfort.
verse.verse_24: Eat and drink a contentful recompense for that you sent forth in the days gone by.
verse.verse_25: And as for him whose record shall be given in his left hand, he will say, 'oh would that, I had not been given my record!
verse.verse_26: And I would not have known what is my reckoning?
verse.verse_27: Oh, would that death had made an end of me.
verse.verse_28: My wealth has availed me nothing.
verse.verse_29: My all strength has gone from me.
verse.verse_30: Seize him and put chains in his neck.
verse.verse_31: Then cast him into blowing fire.
verse.verse_32: Then thrust him in a chain the length of which is seventy cubits.
verse.verse_33: Undoubtedly, he did not believe in Allah, the Great.
verse.verse_34: And he did not urge the feeding of the needy.
verse.verse_35: Therefore he today has no friend here.
verse.verse_36: Nor any food save pus of the people of Hell.
verse.verse_37: Which none but the sinners eat?
verse.verse_38: But no, I swear by what you see.
verse.verse_39: And by all that you see not.
verse.verse_40: Undoubtedly, this Quran is the talks with a noble Messenger.
verse.verse_41: And it is not the word of any poet. How little you believe!
verse.verse_42: And it is not the word of any soothsayer. How little you heed!
verse.verse_43: It has been sent down by Him who is the Lord of entire world.
verse.verse_44: And if he would have said against Us even one word forging from himself.
verse.verse_45: We would surely have taken revenge with full force.
verse.verse_46: And then We would surely have severed his life vein.
verse.verse_47: And not any of you could have defended him.
verse.verse_48: And undoubtedly, this Quran is an admonition to the Godfearing.
verse.verse_49: And surely We know that some among you are beliers.
verse.verse_50: And undoubtedly, it is a great sorrow to the infidels.
verse.verse_51: And undoubtedly, it is the truth of absolute certainty.
verse.verse_52: So O beloved Prophet! Glorify your Lord the Great.
